intro: Matelea montana, commonly known as the mountain matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Matelea montana typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to dry conditions with its deep root system. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and grayish in appearance.
